subject: Investing
title: Tax-Loss Harvesting With Dividend Stocks
description: A quick win: understand Tax-Loss Harvesting With Dividend Stocks.

hook.text: An investor sold a losing dividend stock, saved $3,000 in taxes, and immediately bought a similar ETF for income.

buildup.text: Tax-loss harvesting means selling a position at a loss to offset capital gains elsewhere in your portfolio.

discovery.text: You can deduct up to $3,000 in net losses against ordinary income, carrying excess losses into future years.

twist.text: The wash-sale rule prevents buying a 'substantially identical' security within 30 days, or the loss is disallowed.

climax.text: Swap into a similar but not identical dividend ETF to maintain income while capturing the tax benefit.

punchline.text: Losses aren't just setbacks. With harvesting, they become tax-saving tools.

quiz.question: What does the wash-sale rule prevent?
options: Repurchasing a substantially identical security within 30 days to claim a loss
